seriesJson.title: Composer in the world of today
seriesJson.description: How the composer of today sees the contemporary world around him. Interviews, commentary and musical illustration provide a better picture of the modern composer. The series is hosted by Burrill Phillips, composer and professor of music at the University of Illinois.

node.title: Chamber music for brass
node.description: This program, "Chamber Music for Brass," discusses a popular development in contemporary classical music at the time.

node.title: An unusual trio
node.description: This program, "An Unusual Trio," focuses on a trio consisting of  piano, flute, and oboe.

node.title: American work for chorus and orchestra
node.description: This program focuses on contemporary  American compositions for choruses with orchestral accompaniment.

node.title: Music by Peter Mennin
node.description: This program looks at the music of 20th century American composer Peter Mennin and how it illustrates characteristics of contemporary music midway through the century.

node.title: Four-hand music for piano
node.description: This program focuses on piano compositions for four hands, as well as the pianists who excel at four-hand piano.

node.title: American work for chorus and orchestra
node.description: This program focuses on contemporary  American compositions for choruses with orchestral accompaniment.

node.title: Symphony of premonition and reminiscence
node.description: This program, "A Symphony of Premonition and Reminiscence," focuses on the work of Henry Cowell.

node.title: Paradox of strict limitation
node.description: This program, "Paradox of Strict Limitation," discusses the virtues of self-imposed limitation in modern composition.

node.title: Composers discuss music, part two
node.description: Two young American composers, Robert Wykes and Kenneth Gaburo,  discussing their music. "Sextet for Strings" by Robert Wykes is performed.

node.title: Composers discuss music, part one
node.description: This program, the first of two parts, features two young American composers, Robert Wykes and Kenneth Gaburo,  discuss their music.

node.title: Making the new out of the old
node.description: This program, "Making the New Out of the Old," focuses on compositions that strive to ignore standard tropes in songwriting. Bernard Rogers' composition "Leaves from the Tale of Pinocchio," is highlighted.
